definitions.definition: To build , line , or form with bricks.
examples: to be bricked alive (as a form of capital punishment)

definitions.definition: To hit someone or something with a brick.
To make (an electronic device) non-functional and usually beyond repair, as a result of software or configuration issues.
examples: My VCR was bricked during the lightning storm.

definitions.definition: Of an electronic device , to become non-functional, especially in a way beyond repair, as a result of software or configuration issues.
examples: My phone bricked halfway through the videoconference.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To build , line , or form with bricks.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , slang ) To hit someone or something with a brick.
( transitive , computing slang ) To make (an electronic device) non-functional and usually beyond repair, as a result of software or configuration issues.
( intransitive , computing slang ) Of an electronic device , to become non-functional, especially in a way beyond repair, as a result of software or configuration issues.
( intransitive , slang ) To blunder ; to screw up .
